<s> Which laptop model do you consider the optimal choice for versatile computing, powerful performance, and innovative features that enhance your work and entertainment experience?Whether you are a business executive, a student, or someone who simply enjoys using technology to stay connected, one of the most important considerations is the laptop computer. Choosing the optimal model means considering performance, durability, portability, battery life, and many other factors.In this article, we'll explore which laptops offer the best combination of features for all-around versatile computing. We'll examine laptops from some of the most well-known brands in the market, including Apple, Lenovo, Dell, HP, Asus, Acer, and others, to determine which laptops stand out as the best choice for versatile computing.What is the best laptop for versatile computing?What are the main features of versatile laptops?How much should you spend on a versatile laptop?Which laptop is the best for video editing?What are the best laptops for programming?The top laptop for versatile computing is the HP Spectre x360, a premium 2-in-1 laptop that offers powerful performance, excellent battery life, and a sleek design. It has a 13.3-inch display, a quad-core 11th-gen Intel Core i7 processor, 16GB of RAM, and 1TB of storage. The HP Spectre x360 also boasts a comfortable keyboard, excellent sound quality, and a stunning OLED display. It's the perfect choice for those who need a versatile laptop that can handle demanding tasks and provide a great entertainment experience.Versatile laptops are designed with several key features that make them ideal for users who need to be able to switch between different tasks and use their laptop for various purposes. Here are some of the main features of versatile laptops:Powerful performance: Versatile laptops are typically equipped with powerful processors, large amounts of RAM, and sufficient storage space to handle demanding tasks and applications.Durable construction: Many versatile laptops feature durable build quality, sturdy hinges, and solid displays, allowing them to withstand the rigors of daily use and travel.Long battery life: Versatile laptops often have long battery life, which means that users can use their laptops for extended periods without needing to plug in.Touchscreen display: Many versatile laptops have touchscreen displays, which can be used for a variety of tasks, including browsing the web, editing documents, and watching videos.Ultraportable design: Many versatile laptops are ultraportable, which means they are compact and lightweight, making them easy to carry around.Versatile laptops are designed with the user in mind, providing features that make them ideal for a variety of uses. These laptops are built to be portable, durable, and have long battery life, making them ideal for on-the-go users. Whether you're a student, a business professional, or simply someone who enjoys technology, there's a versatile laptop out there that can meet your needs.When it comes to laptops, there are a variety of prices available depending on the features and specifications. Some affordable laptops may offer basic features and performance while more expensive models may offer more advanced features and higher performance.Here are some popular laptops with their average prices:Apple MacBook Air: starting at $999Dell XPS 13: starting at $999Asus Zenbook: starting at $999Acer Swift 3: starting at $999HP Pavilion: starting at $999Samsung Notebook 7: starting at $999Lenovo ThinkPad: starting at $999The best laptop for video editing depends on your needs and budget. Laptops with powerful processors, large amounts of RAM, and fast storage are ideal for video editing. Here are some of the best laptops for video editing:Apple MacBook Pro: The 16-inch model is equipped with a powerful Intel Core i9 processor, 16GB of RAM, and up to 8TB of storage, making it an ideal choice for video editing.Dell XPS 15: The XPS 15 is equipped with a powerful Intel Core i9 processor, 32GB of RAM, and up to 2TB of storage, making it an excellent choice for video editing.HP Spectre x360: The Spectre x360 is a 2-in-1 laptop that can be used as a laptop or a tablet. It is equipped with an Intel Core i7 processor, 16GB of RAM, and 1TB of storage, making it an excellent choice for video editing.Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Extreme: The ThinkPad X1 Extreme is a high-end laptop with a powerful Intel Core i9 processor, 32GB of RAM, and up to 1TB of storage, making it an excellent choice for video editing.The best laptop for programming depends on the type of programming you need to do. For general-purpose programming, a laptop with a powerful processor and adequate RAM is sufficient. Here are some of the best laptops for programming:Apple MacBook Pro: The MacBook Pro is equipped with a powerful Intel Core i7 processor and up to 16GB of RAM, making it an excellent choice for programming.Dell XPS 15: The XPS 15 is equipped with a powerful Intel Core i7 processor and up to 32GB of RAM, making it an excellent choice for programming.HP Spectre x360: The Spectre x360 is a 2-in-1 laptop with a powerful Intel Core i7 processor and up to 16GB of RAM, making it an excellent choice for programming.Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Extreme: The ThinkPad X1 Extreme is a high-end laptop with a powerful Intel Core i9 processor and up to 32GB of RAM, making it an excellent choice for programming.Laptops are an essential tool for anyone who wants to stay connected, work, and access a variety of applications. They are versatile, portable, and come in a range of styles to suit every taste and budget.When looking for a laptop, it is important to consider the performance, battery life, and display size. Ultraportable laptops are ideal for those who are on the go, while larger laptops offer more powerful performance and storage capacity. The best laptops for versatile computing should offer long battery life, high performance, and plenty of storage.When deciding which laptop to buy, it is important to consider what features are important to you and what your budget is. Considering these factors will help you find the perfect laptop that meets your needs and budget. With the right laptop, you can enjoy all the benefits of versatile computing and stay connected with ease.Do you prefer the MacBook Pro or Dell XPS for video editing?When it comes to video editing, both the MacBook Pro and the Dell XPS are excellent choices. Both offer powerful processors, plenty of RAM, and high-quality graphics cards for seamless video editing. The MacBook Pro is ideal for users who prefer a Mac-based operating system, while the Dell XPS is a great choice for those who prefer Windows-based machines. Ultimately, it comes down to personal preference and budget, as both laptops offer similar performance and features for video editing.Which laptop is best for gaming?If you're looking for a laptop for gaming, the Acer Predator Helios is an excellent choice. It features a powerful Intel Core i7 processor, 16GB of RAM, and a dedicated NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 graphics card, making it capable of handling the most demanding games. The laptop also features a fast storage drive and a high-resolution display, making it a great choice for gamers.What laptop is best for photography and video editing?If you're looking for a laptop for photography and video editing, the MacBook Pro is an excellent choice. It features a powerful Intel Core i7 processor, 16GB of RAM, and a dedicated AMD Radeon Pro 560X graphics card, making it capable of handling even the most demanding photography and video editing tasks. The laptop also features a high-resolution Retina display and a fast storage drive, making it a great choice for creatives.</s>

<s> Which laptop model do you consider the optimal choice for versatile computing, powerful performance, and innovative features that enhance your work and entertainment experience? <s> Which laptop model do you consider the optimal choice for versatile computing, powerful performance, and innovative features that enhance your work and entertainment experience? This is a challenging question to answer, given the countless options on the market. The best option is to compare the features of each brand’s laptops and select one that best suits your needs and budget.The first factor to consider is the screen size and resolution. 15.6-inch Full HD or QHD screens are ideal for work and entertainment, as they allow you to perform multiple tasks and view images and videos in full detail.The next factor to consider is the CPU and GPU. These components determine the laptop’s performance and determine the performance of tasks like gaming and video editing. The latest 11th Gen Intel CPUs provide impressive performance, while the NVIDIA RTX 30 series GPUs are ideal for high-performance tasks such as gaming and video editing.The next factor to consider is the RAM and storage. The RAM determines how many tasks can be performed simultaneously and the storage determines how much data can be stored on the laptop. 8GB RAM and 512GB storage are standard for most laptops, but 16GB RAM and 1TB storage provide the most performance.The next factor to consider is the design. Some laptops are slim and light, while others are large and bulky. For travelers, a slim and lightweight laptop is ideal, while those who work from home may prefer a large and powerful laptop.The next factor to consider is the operating system. Windows 10 is the most popular operating system, while MacOS is ideal for creative professionals. Chromebooks are ideal for those who require a lightweight and portable laptop.The next factor to consider is the price. Some laptops are expensive, while others are affordable. There are many options available for different budgets, so it is important to find the one that best suits your needs and budget.Finally, the best laptop depends on your needs and budget. With the information mentioned above, you can easily compare the features of each brand’s laptops and select one that best suits your needs and budget.</s>

<s> Which laptop model do you consider the optimal choice for versatile computing, powerful performance, and innovative features that enhance your work and entertainment experience? Many users will immediately recommend the HP ZBook x2.Whether you're an IT professional who needs to access a virtual machine or a video editor who needs to process multiple streams of HD footage, this laptop has the power and performance to meet your needs.But what about the battery life? The HP ZBook x2 is notorious for having poor battery life, making it challenging to use when you're on the go or away from a power source. If you're like many users who are experiencing battery problems with their HP ZBook x2, you're in luck!There are several steps you can take to improve your HP ZBook x2's battery life. In this article, we'll walk you through the top 10 ways to optimize your laptop's battery life and make it last longer on a single charge.Why Do HP ZBook X2 Batteries Drain So Fast?While many manufacturers have improved battery life in their products, HP is one of the few companies that hasn't kept up with the competition.HP ZBook x2 battery life is significantly lower than comparable laptops, especially after a few years of use. The issue is that HP's battery technology is outdated and hasn't been improved in years.In addition, HP ZBook x2 batteries have a limited lifespan. As they age, the capacity and performance decrease, leading to frequent replacement. While HP ZBook x2's battery life is often lower than other laptops, this doesn't mean it can't be improved.Many simple steps can help increase the battery life of your HP ZBook x2. Here are some of the top ways to optimize your laptop's battery life and make it last longer on a single charge.1. Use a Custom FirmwareA custom firmware is a modified version of the original firmware installed on a device. It provides access to advanced settings, including battery optimization options.By using a custom firmware, you can optimize your HP ZBook x2's battery life and make it last longer on a single charge.Some of the benefits of using a custom firmware on your HP ZBook x2 include:Increased battery life: You can customize your battery settings to extend the battery life of your HP ZBook x2.Enhanced performance: Custom firmware can optimize your device's performance, reducing battery drain.More control: With a custom firmware, you have more control over your device's battery life and performance.Improved security: Custom firmware can help protect your device from security threats by limiting access to certain settings.2. Disable Unnecessary Services and ProcessesWhile it's important to enable services and processes that support your HP ZBook x2's hardware, it's also essential to disable unnecessary services and processes. These can drain the battery unnecessarily, reducing the life of the device.To disable unnecessary services and processes, follow these steps:Right-click on the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen and select "Task Manager."Select "Processes" on the top menu and "Startup" in the top-right corner.Locate and disable any unnecessary services and processes in the "Startup" tab.Restart your computer to apply the changes.3. Monitor Battery Levels and TemperatureIt's essential to monitor battery levels and temperatures to ensure your HP ZBook x2 is functioning correctly. If your battery level drops unexpectedly, this could be a sign of a problem.In addition, monitoring battery levels and temperatures can help you optimize your device's performance and extend its battery life.Some of the benefits of monitoring battery levels and temperatures include:Reduced risk of battery problems: By monitoring battery levels and temperatures, you can identify potential issues and take steps to resolve them before they become a problem.Improved performance: Monitoring battery levels and temperatures can help you optimize your device's performance and extend its battery life.Increased safety: Monitoring battery levels and temperatures can help you identify potential safety issues and take steps to prevent them.4. Avoid Heavy Applications and ProcessesWhile it's important to run demanding applications and processes on your HP ZBook x2, it's also crucial to avoid running too many at once. Heavy applications and processes can strain your device's battery, reducing its lifespan.To avoid heavy applications and processes, follow these tips:Turn off unnecessary applications: Before running an application, ask yourself whether it's essential to the task at hand. If it isn't, turn it off to reduce battery drain.Disable background processes: Background processes are applications that run in the background without your knowledge. These processes can drain your device's battery, so it's essential to disable them.Close unnecessary tabs: When using a web browser, only open the tabs you need. Closing unnecessary tabs will help reduce battery drain.5. Limit Screen TimeIt's essential to limit screen time on your HP ZBook x2 to extend its battery life. Excessive screen time can strain your device's battery, reducing its lifespan.To limit screen time, follow these tips:Schedule breaks: Take breaks from your device during the day to allow the battery to recharge.Turn off the screen when not in use: When your HP ZBook x2 is not in use, turn off the screen to reduce battery drain.Reduce brightness: Reduce the brightness of your HP ZBook x2's screen to reduce battery drain.6. Avoid Bluetooth and Wi-Fi ConnectivityWhile it's important to use Bluetooth and Wi-Fi connectivity on your HP ZBook x2, it's also essential to limit their use. Both of these technologies can drain your device's battery, reducing its lifespan.To avoid Bluetooth and Wi-Fi connectivity, follow these tips:Turn off Bluetooth and Wi-Fi connectivity when not in use: If your HP ZBook x2 isn't in use, turn off Bluetooth and Wi-Fi connectivity to reduce battery drain.Disable Bluetooth and Wi-Fi scanning: If your HP ZBook x2 is in use, disable Bluetooth and Wi-Fi scanning to reduce battery drain.Avoid connecting to Bluetooth and Wi-Fi hotspots: If you need to connect to a Bluetooth or Wi-Fi hotspot, ensure it's secure and trusted.7. Avoid Frequent ChargingIt's essential to avoid frequent charging on your HP ZBook x2 to increase its battery life. Frequent charging can reduce the lifespan of the device's battery.To avoid frequent charging, follow these tips:Don't leave the battery fully charged: It's best to avoid leaving the battery fully charged for extended periods.Avoid charging when not needed: If your HP ZBook x2 isn't in use, avoid charging it.Turn off the charging cable when not in use: When the battery is charged and the device is in use, turn off the charging cable.8. Install Battery Management SoftwareWhile it's essential to use battery management software on your HP ZBook x2 to monitor and optimize battery life. This software can help you prolong the lifespan of your device's battery.Some of the benefits of using battery management software include:Improved battery life: Battery management software can help you optimize battery life, making your device last longer on a single charge.Better battery health: Battery management software can help you monitor the health of your device's battery, ensuring it's always working correctly.Better security: Battery management software can help you protect your device from security threats by limiting access to certain settings.9. Reduce Internal TemperaturesWhile it's essential to use cooling fans on your HP ZBook x2, it's also important to reduce internal temperatures. High temperatures can cause the battery to drain quickly, reducing its lifespan.To reduce internal temperatures, follow these tips:Clean the device regularly: Regular cleaning will help prevent dust and debris from building up and causing the device to overheat.Avoid using the device in extreme temperatures: If you use your HP ZBook x2 in extreme temperatures, such as hot or cold weather, ensure the device is properly insulated.Turn off the device when not in use: When the device is not in use, turn it off to reduce internal temperatures.10. Maintain Your DeviceWhile it's essential to maintain your HP ZBook x2 to increase its battery life. Regular maintenance can help prevent battery problems and ensure your device is always working correctly.Some of the benefits of maintaining your HP ZBook x2 include:Increased safety: Regular maintenance can help prevent safety issues and ensure your device is always working correctly.Improved performance: Regular maintenance can help optimize the performance of your HP ZBook x2, making it run faster and more efficiently.Longer lifespan: Regular maintenance can help prolong the lifespan of your device's battery, making it last longer on a single charge.If you want to extend your HP ZBook x2's battery life, there are several ways to do so. The key is to optimize your device's battery and temperature, use custom firmware and optimize your system settings, and prevent frequent charging.By following these tips, you can significantly improve the battery life of your HP ZBook x2, making it last longer on a single charge. Additionally, regular maintenance can help prevent battery problems and ensure your device is always working correctly.By taking these steps, you can enjoy the benefits of your HP ZBook x2 without worrying about battery life.Which laptop model do you consider the optimal choice for versatile computing, powerful performance, and innovative features that enhance your work and entertainment experience? Many users will immediately recommend the HP ZBook x2.</s>

<s> Which laptop model do you consider the optimal choice for versatile computing, powerful performance, and innovative features that enhance your work and entertainment experience?What factors should you consider before purchasing a laptop? What budget and screen size should you expect? How many storage drives and RAM should you aim for? What operating system is recommended?In this article, we address all of these questions and more.Differences between laptops, computers, notebooks, and tabletsLaptops, computers, notebooks, and tablets are different but related. What exactly are the differences?A computer is a personal computer or PC.A laptop is a portable computer, usually with a screen size of 11 inches to 16 inches.A notebook is a small portable computer that is thinner and smaller than a laptop.A tablet is a handheld computer. It has a touch screen.In this article, we’ll focus on laptops since these are the most common and versatile computer models.How much should you expect to pay for a new laptop?The cost of a new laptop varies depending on the type of laptop and its features. The least expensive laptops sell for around $400. The most expensive laptops can be several thousand dollars. The average price for a new laptop is about $1,200.As a guideline, the following laptop prices provide an indication of costs.Laptops cost around $400.Laptops cost between $500 and $1,000.Laptops cost between $1,000 and $1,500.Laptops cost between $1,500 and $3,000.Laptops cost over $3,000.Laptop costs depend on factors such as the operating system (e.g., Microsoft Windows 10, Mac OS, Google Chrome OS), processor (e.g., 6th generation Intel Core i7), storage (e.g., 128 GB SSD hard drive), and screen size (e.g., 15.6-inch).As a general guideline, the higher the screen resolution, the better. You should also consider the processor and memory since these are essential for fast and efficient performance.Laptop screen sizesWhat are the screen sizes of laptops, and which are the best screen sizes?Most laptops have screens that range in size from 11 inches to 16 inches. However, you should select a screen size based on your needs.What features are ideal for your needs? What are the benefits of a large screen size?If you require a large screen size, consider a laptop that has an 11-inch to 14-inch display.A 15-inch display offers a larger work area but is more difficult to transport.If you require a very large display, consider a laptop with a 17-inch or larger display.Laptop battery life: How long does it last?The battery life of a laptop varies depending on several factors.The type of laptop is a key factor. You should consider the size of the battery (e.g., 6-cell vs 9-cell) and the type of processor and memory. A laptop with a larger battery and faster processor will have a longer battery life than a laptop with a smaller battery and slower processor.Another important factor is the screen. A laptop with a smaller screen will require a smaller battery and will have a shorter battery life. On the other hand, a laptop with a larger screen will require a larger battery and will have a longer battery life.Finally, the operating system is a factor. A laptop with a lighter operating system (e.g., Chrome OS, Linux) will have a shorter battery life than a laptop with a heavier operating system (e.g., Windows).Laptop processors: What’s the difference?Different types of processors are available. You should select the processor that best suits your needs.There are several types of processors, including Intel processors, AMD processors, and ARM processors. Each type of processor has different advantages and disadvantages.If you require high performance, consider a laptop with an Intel processor. If you require high power efficiency, consider a laptop with an AMD processor. If you require high mobility, consider a laptop with an ARM processor.How much storage space do you need on a laptop?The amount of storage space you need on a laptop depends on your needs.If you need a lot of storage space, consider a laptop with a solid state drive (SSD) and a high-capacity drive. If you only need a small amount of storage space, consider a laptop with a hard drive.You should also consider the type of operating system you are using. A laptop with a Windows operating system will require a higher storage capacity than a laptop with a Mac operating system.Is a 15.6-inch screen too big for a laptop?There is no one answer to this question. It depends on your needs.If you need a large screen, consider a laptop with a 15.6-inch display. If you only need a smaller screen, consider a laptop with a 14-inch display.What operating systems are available on laptops?There are several operating systems available on laptops. You should select the operating system that best suits your needs.There are several types of operating systems, including Windows, Mac OS, Linux, and Chrome OS. Each type of operating system has different advantages and disadvantages.A laptop with a Windows operating system is more likely to have a large display. A laptop with a Mac OS is more likely to have a smaller display. A laptop with a Linux operating system is more likely to have a smaller screen size.What are the most popular laptop brands?The most popular laptop brands include:Each of these brands offers a range of laptops that are suitable for different needs. You should consider the brand and the features of each laptop before making a purchase.What are the best laptop brands?The best laptop brands include:Each of these brands offers a range of laptops that are suitable for different needs. You should consider the brand and the features of each laptop before making a purchase. When you have the best laptop, your computing experience is sure to improve!1 thought on “What To Look For When Buying A New Laptop”Pingback: Best laptop for business - Best Laptop</s>

<s> Which laptop model do you consider the optimal choice for versatile computing, powerful performance, and innovative features that enhance your work and entertainment experience? While many laptop models meet your needs, it is important to select a laptop that is within your budget and offers the features you want.Laptops are versatile computing devices that are suitable for both work and leisure activities. They are lightweight and portable, making it easy to take them with you wherever you go. They have a range of features that enhance your work and entertainment experience, including high-resolution displays, powerful processors, and advanced graphics capabilities.While many laptop models meet your needs, there is no one-size-fits-all solution. You need to carefully consider your budget, computing needs, and entertainment preferences before making a purchase. To help you find the optimal laptop for you, we have created this buying guide.We’ll explore some of the top laptop models available today and highlight their pros and cons. Whether you’re looking for a powerful gaming laptop, a sleek and portable model, or a budget-friendly option, we’ve got you covered.When shopping for a new laptop, one of the first things to consider is your budget. Laptop models range in price from a few hundred dollars to several thousand, depending on the features and specifications. <s> Which laptop model do you consider the optimal choice for versatile computing, powerful performance, and innovative features that enhance your work and entertainment experience?For answers, look no further than Apple’s MacBook Air laptop model. In 2020, it was the fastest-selling Mac model worldwide. It is a compact notebook, so light it is barely noticeable when placed on a lap. The best part? Its compact design does not compromise power and performance. You get the same features as bigger laptops with greater versatility.As a compact laptop, the MacBook Air has a compact footprint. It measures 304.1 mm x 212.4 mm x 14.9 mm and weighs 1.29 kg, making it lightweight enough to carry around with ease. If you need a compact laptop that offers a larger screen without sacrificing portability, the MacBook Air is an excellent choice. Its 13.3-inch display has the same 16:9 aspect ratio as a 13-inch model, but its 16:10 aspect ratio offers more screen space and greater productivity.In terms of design, the MacBook Air features a sleek and streamlined look with a high-quality build. The body is made from aluminum, which gives it a premium feel and prevents it from flexing. The keyboard and trackpad are ergonomically designed, providing a comfortable typing experience.The MacBook Air is equipped with a range of ports, including four Thunderbolt 3 ports, a headphone jack, and a microSDXC card slot, making it easy to connect to external displays, storage devices, and other accessories.For connectivity, the MacBook Air has a built-in Wi-Fi 6 (802.11ax) and Bluetooth 5.0 wireless, providing fast and reliable internet connectivity. Additionally, it comes with a 720p FaceTime HD camera, which delivers high-quality video conferencing.The MacBook Air comes with a range of advanced features that enhance your work and entertainment experience. For example, its Liquid Retina display is high-resolution and features a range of color and brightness options, making it easy to work and watch videos on the go. Additionally, its built-in speakers deliver high-quality audio for music, video, and podcasts.In terms of security, the MacBook Air is equipped with advanced security features, including a built-in Secure Enclave that protects your biometric information, like your fingerprint. It also comes with built-in security features such as Apple T2 chip that protects your device and data against unauthorized access.The MacBook Air is available in three color options: space gray, silver, and gold. It is available in three storage configurations: 256 GB, 512 GB, and 2 TB, allowing you to choose the storage option that best suits your needs. Additionally, it is available with a range of processor options, including Intel Core i5, Intel Core i7, and Intel Core i9, providing you with the performance and power you need for your daily tasks.What are the specifications of the MacBook Air model?The MacBook Air model is equipped with a range of powerful specifications. It comes with the latest Apple M1 processor, which delivers powerful performance and energy efficiency. It also comes with 8 GB of unified memory and 256 GB, 512 GB, or 2 TB of storage. Additionally, it features a 13.3-inch Liquid Retina display with a resolution of 2560 x 1600, a backlit keyboard, and a built-in fingerprint reader.What are the advantages of the MacBook Air model?One of the main advantages of the MacBook Air model is its compact size and lightweight design. It is compact enough to carry around with ease, making it an excellent choice for those who need to work and travel frequently. Additionally, its powerful specifications and advanced features, such as the Liquid Retina display and FaceTime HD camera, make it an excellent choice for those who need a versatile and powerful laptop.What are the disadvantages of the MacBook Air model?One of the main disadvantages of the MacBook Air model is its limited connectivity options. While it comes with four Thunderbolt 3 ports, it does not have USB-A or HDMI ports, which may be inconvenient for those who need to connect to legacy devices. Additionally, its small size and lightweight design may limit its compatibility with larger monitors and docking stations.How does the MacBook Air model compare to other laptops in its price range?The MacBook Air model is an excellent choice for those looking for a powerful and versatile laptop in its price range. It is more powerful and versatile than other laptops in its price range, making it an excellent choice for those who need a high-performance laptop for daily tasks. Additionally, its advanced features, such as the Liquid Retina display and FaceTime HD camera, make it an excellent choice for those who need a laptop for work and entertainment.Is the MacBook Air model suitable for gaming and video editing?While the MacBook Air model is a powerful laptop for daily tasks, it is not suitable for gaming and video editing.
